intro: Cysticapnos alexandrina, commonly known as the Alexandrian sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is occasionally cultivated in xeriscapic gardens.
